name.en: Chair of International Business and Innovation

structural_unit_name.en: Chair of International Business and Innovation

description.en: The course provides a definition of innovation and its categories. It takes a systemic approach to innovations. Innovation systems are introduced on several different levels. Attention is drawn to industry-level and regional-level innovation systems. The course compares Estonian innovation policy with those of other countries. The experiences of EU, Finland and Ireland in creation of innovation policies and systems will be investigated in greater detail. The second part of the course provides an understanding about innovation management in a company. It discusses the principles of innovation strategy formation, the processes of product and service innovations, and the impact of organizational structures on the success of innovation processes.
description.et: Loengukursuse käigus avatakse innovatsiooni mõiste ja selle erinevad liigid. Seejärel tuuakse sisse innovatsiooni süsteemse käsitluse temaatika. Tutvustatakse erinevaid tasandeid innovatsioonisüsteemide käsitlemisel. Eraldi tuuakse välja sektoraalsed ja regionaalsed innovatsioonisüsteemid. Seejärel analüüsitakse võrdlevalt Eesti innovatsioonipoliitikat teiste riikidega. Põhjalikumalt analüüsitakse Euroopa Liidu, Soome ja Iirimaa tegevust innovatsioonipoliitika kujundamisel ja innovatsioonisüsteemi arendamisel. Kursuse teine pool annab tervikliku ettekujutuse innovatsiooni juhtimisest ettevõttes. Avatakse innovatsioonistrateegiate kujundamise põhimõtted, tutvustatakse toodete ja teenuste innovatsiooniprotsesside põhimõtteid ja selgitatakse ettevõtte organisatsioonilise ülesehituse mõju innovatsiooniprotsesside edukusele.

objectives.en: The general objective of the course is:
a)to form understanding about the multilevel character of the innovation as a process;
objectives.et: 1.kujundada arusaam innovatsiooni kui protsessi mitmetasandilisest iseloomust.

objectives.en: b)to provide a vision of relationships between national innovation policy and innovation processes of companies;
objectives.et: 2.tuua nägemus riikliku innovatsioonipoliitika ja ettevõtete innovatsiooniprotsesside seostest.

objectives.en: c)to give knowledge about innovation management on different (national, industry and company) levels of economy;
objectives.et: 3.anda teadmised innovatsiooni juhtimisest majanduse erinevatel (rahvamajanduse, sektori ja ettevõtte) tasanditel.

objectives.en: d)to create via discussions experiences for interpretation and transfer of earlier innovation practices.
objectives.et: 4.luua arutluste käigus kogemusi innovatsioonikogemuste tõlgendamiseks ja ülekandmiseks.

learning_outcomes.en: a) knowledge of main notion concerning innovation management;
b) comprehension of innovation management mechanisms on national, industry and company levels;
learning_outcomes.et: b)arusaam innovatsioonijuhtimise mehhanismist nii rahvamajanduse, majandussektori kui ka ettevõtte tasandil;

learning_outcomes.en: c) knowledge about innovation systems and -policies in Estonia and in other EU member-states;
learning_outcomes.et: c)teadmised nii Eesti kui ka Euroopa Liidu teiste riikide innovatsioonisüsteemidest ja innovatsioonipoliitikast;

learning_outcomes.en: d) ability to evaluate the importance of innovation management in a company and for the country's development in general;
learning_outcomes.et: d)oskus hinnata innovatsioonijuhtimise tähtsust nii ettevõtte kui riigi arengus tervikuna;

learning_outcomes.en: e) capability to analyze company's innovation process and to implement measures for its governance;
learning_outcomes.et: e)suutlikus analüüsida ettevõtete innovatsiooniprotsessi ja rakendada meetmeid nende protsesside suunamiseks;

learning_outcomes.en: f) capability to evaluate the efficiency of Estonian innovation system and innovation policy;
learning_outcomes.et: f)suutlikus hinnata Eesti innovatsioonisüsteemi ja innovatsioonipoliitika tõhusust;

learning_outcomes.en: g) competence to use the acquired knowledge and skills in the analysis and management of innovation processes.
learning_outcomes.et: g)oskus rakendada omandatud teadmisi ja oskusi innovatsiooniportsesside analüüsimisel ja juhtimisel;

learning_outcomes.en: h) capability to recognize relationships between the national innovation policy and the possibilities for the management of innovation processes in a company.
learning_outcomes.et: h)võime näha seoseid riigi innovatsioonipoliitika ja ettevõtete innovatsiooniportsesside juhtimise võimaluste vahel.

independent_work.et:
*	Individual reading of the compulsory study materials, e.g. book chapters and articles.  Compulsory readings will be provided in the Study Information System (SIS).
*	Individual analysis of an article about innovation management, and its short presentation in the class. Sample articles will be provided in the SIS.
*	Group home assignment - a 10-15 page report about a concept of a new product, service, marketing activity, business process or business model, and its presentation in the class.
Detailed instructions will be given in the class and uploaded in the SIS.

description.et: EXAM and FINAL GRADE. The assessment is based on the student's knowledge about the innovation management main concepts and terminology. These include, but are not limited to, innovation management at the macro- and micro level, innovation systems, innovation policy mechanisms, the role of innovation in the development, innovation processes in firms, and the interrelations between the above. The written exam at the end of the course gives 50% of the final grade and home assignments with presentations the other 50%. Home assignments have to be submitted by the set deadline, otherwise 1 point will be deducted for each delayed day. Final grades according to the sum of the exam and homework are as follows: 100 points is maximum, 100-90,5 points "A", 90-80,5 points grade "B", 80-70,5 "C", 70-60,5 "D", and 60-50,5 "E".

PRESENTATION OF AN ARTICLE REVIEW. As an individual home assignment, the student will critically review an article about some aspects related to innovation management, and make a short presentation in the class. This assignment gives maximum 10% of the final grade. It gives extra 10 points

GROUP HOME ASSIGNMENT. In groups of 2-3 students a report about a concept of a new product, service, marketing activity, business process or business model has to be compiled. Detailed instructions will be explained in the class and uploaded among the study materials. This assignment gives maximum 40% of the final grade.
PRESENTATION OF THE GROUP HOME ASSIGNMENT. The group will also make a short presentation about their home assignment, this gives maximum 10% of the final grade.

grade_preconditions.et: Individual and group home assignments with presentations are a precondition for exam.

grade_evaluation.et:
Max 100 points:
10 individual home assignment - an article review and its short presentation in the class.
30 group home assignment- a 10-15 page report about a concept related to innovation
10 presentation of the group home assignment in the class
50 written final exam
Points will be deducted if the home assignments are not submitted in time.

debt_elimination.et: At least one option will be given to redo the exam during the same semester.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

resources.mandatory_materials:
Compulsory reading materials:
*Lecture slides in Study System 
*Joseph Tidd_ J R Bessant (2009) Managing innovation _ integrating technological, market and organizational change. 4 ed. Wiley Publisher (2009)
* selected chapters from the Joseph Bessant, Joe Tidd (2011) Innovation and entrepreneurship. 2nd ed.
*Articles for the presentation in classroom (in special folder in Study System)
resources.recommended_materials:
Recommended reading materials: 
*D.O'Sullivan (2014) Applied innovation. National University of ireland.
*E.von Hippel (2017) Free Innovation. MIT Press
* Margaret A. White, Garry D. Bruton-The Management of Technology and Innovation. A Strategic Approach, 2nd Edition-Cengage Learning (2011)
* Mark Dodgson, David M. Gann, Ammon Salter-The Management of Technological Innovation_ Strategy and Practice (2008).pdf

Recommended video materials
*special files with links to You tube video clips about Innovation management are in Study System
